refnamediv.refpurpose: create buttons which retain their state.

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Properties
refsect1.synopsis: "active" gboolean : Read / Write "draw-indicator" gboolean : Read / Write "inconsistent" gboolean : Read / Write

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: A GtkToggleButton is a GtkButton which will remain 'pressed-in' when clicked. Clicking again will cause the toggle button to return to its normal state.

A toggle button is created by calling either gtk_toggle_button_new() or gtk_toggle_button_new_with_label(). If using the former, it is advisable to pack a widget, (such as a GtkLabel and/or a GtkPixmap), into the toggle button's container. (See GtkButton for more information).
The state of a GtkToggleButton can be set specifically using gtk_toggle_button_set_active(), and retrieved using gtk_toggle_button_get_active().
To simply switch the state of a toggle button, use gtk_toggle_button_toggled.

refsect2.title: struct GtkToggleButton
refsect2.para: The GtkToggleButton struct contains private data only, and should be manipulated using the functions below.

refsect2.title: gtk_toggle_button_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new toggle button. A widget should be packed into the button, as in gtk_button_new().

refsect2.title: gtk_toggle_button_new_with_label ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new toggle button with a text label.

listitem.simpara: a string containing the message to be placed in the toggle button.

refsect2.title: gtk_toggle_button_new_with_mnemonic ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GtkToggleButton containing a label. The label will be created using gtk_label_new_with_mnemonic(), so underscores in label indicate the mnemonic for the button.

listitem.simpara: the text of the button, with an underscore in front of the mnemonic character

refsect2.title: gtk_toggle_button_set_mode ()
refsect2.para: Sets whether the button is displayed as a separate indicator and label. You can call this function on a checkbutton or a radiobutton with draw_indicator = FALSE to make the button look like a normal button
This function only effects instances of classes like GtkCheckButton and GtkRadioButton that derive from GtkToggleButton, not instances of GtkToggleButton itself.

listitem.simpara: if TRUE, draw the button as a separate indicator and label; if FALSE, draw the button like a normal button

refsect2.title: gtk_toggle_button_get_mode ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves whether the button is displayed as a separate indicator and label. See gtk_toggle_button_set_mode().

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the togglebutton is drawn as a separate indicator and label.

refsect2.title: gtk_toggle_button_set_state

warning.para: gtk_toggle_button_set_state is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: This is a deprecated macro, and is only maintained for compatibility reasons.

refsect2.title: gtk_toggle_button_toggled ()
refsect2.para: Emits the toggled signal on the GtkToggleButton. There is no good reason for an application ever to call this function.

refsect2.title: gtk_toggle_button_get_active ()
refsect2.para: Queries a GtkToggleButton and returns its current state. Returns TRUE if the toggle button is pressed in and FALSE if it is raised.

refsect2.title: gtk_toggle_button_set_active ()
refsect2.para: Sets the status of the toggle button. Set to TRUE if you want the GtkToggleButton to be 'pressed in', and FALSE to raise it. This action causes the toggled signal to be emitted.

refsect2.title: gtk_toggle_button_get_inconsistent ()
refsect2.para: Gets the value set by gtk_toggle_button_set_inconsistent().

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the button is displayed as inconsistent, FALSE otherwise

refsect2.title: gtk_toggle_button_set_inconsistent ()
refsect2.para: If the user has selected a range of elements (such as some text or spreadsheet cells) that are affected by a toggle button, and the current values in that range are inconsistent, you may want to display the toggle in an "in between" state. This function turns on "in between" display. Normally you would turn off the inconsistent state again if the user toggles the toggle button. This has to be done manually, gtk_toggle_button_set_inconsistent() only affects visual appearance, it doesn't affect the semantics of the button.

listitem.para: If the toggle button should be pressed in or not.
If the toggle part of the button is displayed.
If the toggle button is in an "in between" state.

refsect2.title: The "toggled" signal
refsect2.para: Should be connected if you wish to perform an action whenever the GtkToggleButton's state is changed.

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

listitem.para: another way of presenting a toggle option.
a GtkToggleButton as a menu item.
